markdownRemark.html:
I did a dive off the Beachhopper II and the conditions were a bit bumpy so we didn‚Äôt head out far from Monterey Bay. One of my favorite dive sites is one called Shale Island which to my understanding was formed during the 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake. It is a raised plateau or what I‚Äôd like to imagine as a giant round table approximately 400ft long and 120ft wide. Under the table top, you will find lots of small critters. I usually dive this site in a clockwise direction then turn around once I hit a sunken anchor covered with strawberry anemonies.

For this time, I ventured to the left or counter-clockwise where we spotted not one, not two, but three fringeheads!

These species are known as the sarcastic fringehead due to their territorial temperament and the decorative ‚Äúbranches‚Äù above their eyes.

I also spotted a baby wolf eel hiding inside its hole and I couldn‚Äôt get enough of her. So cute!

My dive buddy also spotted a sleeping octopus but alas, I couldn‚Äôt get a shot cause I ran out of battery! The 90mm lens consumes more juice due to the autofocus action so I need to figure this out next time.

Here‚Äôs more fringehead photos.

What do you think of these sarcastic dudes? üòà

Do you think the name is apropos?
